hi <@U02625MJG3W>! We continue to use Ghost for our blog (agree that the guest author/contributor ‘management’ is super annoying there!) and Contentful for our larger “resources”, including books, with plans to build out a more robust library like the Slack example you mentioned. <https://clearbit.com/resources>. Also have plans to move our whole marketing site content management (still hardcoded)  into Contentful

I can’t speak much to the ease of setup as our growth engineers set everything up (Ghost does seem to be more self-servey from a non-eng perspective - like I can find a way to hack around in there). But once all the templates and preview ability was set — things are pretty easy from the content workflow perspective.

(We tried using Webflow for some book landing pages and I personally really didn’t like using it for the user issue and the workflows to edit/preview felt super convoluted.)
